p: Next, using the SARS‐CoV‐2 pseudovirus, we aimed to functionally validate the correlation between the up‐regulation of CH25H and SARS‐CoV‐2 infection. We overexpressed CH25H in Calu‐3 cells prior to SARS‐CoV‐2 pseudovirus challenge (Fig 1F and G). Our results showed that overexpression of CH25H significantly suppressed SARS‐CoV‐2 pseudovirus infection (Fig 1F and G). Taken together, these data suggest that the up‐regulation of CH25H upon SARS‐CoV‐2 infection in vitro and in vivo restricts SARS‐CoV‐2 infection.
